general_advisory: There is a chance of occurrence of light to moderate rainfall along with thunderstorm and lightning between 10.09.2024 to 8.30 hours IST of 11.09.224, so farmers are advised to wait one more day for irrigation and spraying operation and keep their animal away from any electrical equipment. Drainage of excess water from crop field and storage of that water in nearby bund/pond for future use should be advised.

advisory: Farmers should maintain 5 cm water level in rice field for proper growth.

After rainfall, there may be a chance of infestation of sheath blight and sheath rot disease in rice field so farmers should spray Trifloxystrobin 25% + Tebuconazole 50% WG @ 80 g or, Propiconazole 25% @ 200 ml or, Hexaconazole 5% SC @ 250 ml in 200 litres of water per acre. Repeat the spray at 7-10 daysâ€™ interval.

Bacterial leaf blight attack is also observed in some field, so spraying of Copper Oxychloride 50% WP @ 600g and Streptocycline @ 30g in 200 liter of water per acre should be advised under clear and calm weather.

Keep 3 pheromone traps per acre of rice field for monitoring the stem borer and leaf folder infestations. Whenever the number of male moths/trap reaches 4 or 5, apply Azadirachtin 0.15% EC @ 800 ml/acre or, Chlorantraniliprole 0.4% GR @ 4 kg/acre mixing with sand at 1:1 ratio or, spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 60 ml/acre in 200 litres of water or, Cartap hydrochloride 4G @ 10 kg/acre or, Flubendiamide 20 Gramin Krishi Mausam Sewa India Meteorological Department Orissa University of Agriculture and Technology RRTTS, Chiplima, Sambalpur
To control the flower drop in cotton crop, application of Planofix @ 90 ml in 200 liters of water per acre after 60-65 days after sowing of seed.

To control sucking insect pest (Aphid, Thrips etc.) attack in cotton crop, application of Neem based pesticide like Neem oil @ 600-800 ml + 200g detergent powder per acre by mixing with 200 liters of water should be advised at 30-45 days crop stage under clear weather.
At initial stage of flowering farmers should avoid any chemical application in cotton crop.

To control Fruit and shoot borer in Brinjal, Tomato, Okra etc. spraying of Neem based pesticide 1500 ppm @ 600 ml per acre should be advised at initial stages. In severe cases, the alternate spray of Spinosad 45 % SC @ 70ml and Emamectin benzoate @ 80 g per acre at 15 days interval should be advised.
If sucking insect pest attack noticed, then spraying of thiamethoxam @ 0.2 g or imidacloprid @ 0.33 ml per liter of water should be advised.
For controlling of some diseases like wilt, root rot etc. farmers should use Carbendazim @ 2g or copper oxicloride @ 3ml per liter water under no rainfall condition.

Prevailing weather condition is favourable for thrip attack in Banana plant so at initial stage cover or wrap the bundle with jute bag, area should be weed free and use 15-20 no. of blue sticky card per acre should be advised to control this insect. For chemical control, spraying of Diafenthiuron 50% WP @ 2g per liter (twice at 15 days interval) should be advised.

Mastitis disease is also observed in some animal at present condition due to which milk production and quality may hamper, so some preventive as well as control measures like pre and post dipping with antiseptic liquids, proper sanitation, preventing wet floor surface, feeding during and just after milking to avoid sitting of animals before closure of teat sphincters, lime application on the resting floor, provide mixture of 2 lemons and 200g sugar in one liter water at morning and evening hours etc. should be taken to control this disease. Fresh water availability should be ensured in farm.
